meanings.sent1: After taking a break, she decided to reengage with her studies.
meanings.sent2: He needed to reengage the gears to get the machine working again.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat tried to reengage with the laser pointer but quickly gave up.
meanings.sent4: The old friends were able to reengage their conversation as if no time had passed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to help the students reengage with the lesson.

meanings.definition: To participate or become involved again.
meanings.sent1: She was hesitant to reengage in the group project after a disagreement.
meanings.sent2: The community encouraged everyone to reengage in local events.
meanings.sent3: The lost dog finally found its way back home and tried to reengage with its family.
meanings.sent4: The retired athlete decided to reengage with sports by coaching young players.
meanings.sent5: The volunteer felt fulfilled when she could reengage with helping those in need.
